metadata.title: CVE-2016-9372 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In Wireshark 2.2.0 to 2.2.1, the Profinet I/O dissector could loopexcessively, triggered by network traffic or a capture file. This wasaddressed in plugins/profinet/packet-pn-rtc-one.c by rejecting input withtoo many I/O objects.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9372` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
libwireshark11 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
libwiretap8 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
libwscodecs2 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
libwsutil9 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
tshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
wireshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
wireshark-common - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
wireshark-qt - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1').
